reviews.text: Basic, though quite pleasant station with small fee car park for rail users on one side and a golf course on the other. Partially open waiting shelters on both platforms with a single ticket machine on the eastbound side.  Before boarding a train passengers must obtain either a ticket or “Promise to Pay” voucher, the latter being required if you want to pay later in cash as the machine only accept cards. Whilst there are ramps up to both platforms, wheelchair users will find that if they wish to travel in the direction of Bishop Auckland and need to buy a ticket first, itʼs a rather long trek from one platform to the other via the road bridge a few hundred metres away. Fortunately, for those who can use it a footbridge is provided to avoid this inconvenience. No staff on site or toilet facilities (so inconvenience all round on that front).
Handy little station travelling all the way to Saltburn if required. Nice flat walk over to Shildon approx 2 miles and the Railway Museum
